tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE network_coverage_areas (
    area_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    area_name VARCHAR(50),
    coverage_type VARCHAR(20),
    signal_strength FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE signal_samples (
  sample_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  area_id INT,
  signal_strength INT,
  sample_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (area_id) REFERENCES coverage_areas(area_id)
);

CREATE TABLE signal_strength_data (
  data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  area_id INT,
  signal_reading INT,
  data_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (area_id) REFERENCES network_coverage_areas(area_id)
);

CREATE TABLE signal_analysis_results (
  result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  data_id INT,
  result_value FLOAT,
  analysis_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (data_id) REFERENCES signal_strength_data(data_id)
);

CREATE TABLE signal_readings (
  reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  tower_id INT,
  signal_strength INT,
  reading_time TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (tower_id) REFERENCES signal_towers(tower_id)
);

CREATE TABLE signal_towers (
  tower_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  tower_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  tower_height FLOAT,
  signal_strength FLOAT NOT NULL,
  area_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (area_id) REFERENCES coverage_areas(area_id)
);

CREATE TABLE tower_availability (
  tower_id INT,
  provider_id INT,
  available BOOLEAN,
  PRIMARY KEY (tower_id, provider_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (tower_id) REFERENCES signal_towers(tower_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (provider_id) REFERENCES network_providers(provider_id)
);

CREATE TABLE signal_measurements (
  measurement_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  signal_strength FLOAT NOT NULL,
  tower_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (tower_id) REFERENCES signal_towers(tower_id)
);
